channel.title: Background
channel.description:
I know this is a dumb question, but I really fail when in comes to clients.
I have the background and everything done, but how do I remove the ugly Runescape logo and torch flames at the login screen? I've searched around quite a bit and haven't found anything on it. If it's already been posted before, though, I'm sorry for being dumb.

item.title: Background
item.dc:creator: @Yodoxin Yodoxin
item.description:
@Yodoxin wrote:

[quote=“nicola, post:2, topic:283218”]lol this is pretty easy to do…

in client.java search for this:

anIntArray851 = new int[256];       starting at that line, comment that line through and including
for(int j4 = 0; j4 < 64; j4++)
            anIntArray853[j4 + 192] = 0xffffff;

I know this definately removes the flames as i have done it myself… only issue with doing this is that when you login to server and then back out… you get a little glitch with the background where the flames used to be.

100% credits to “TREY” from another place for giving this to me! and i’ll be happy with a thanks for posting it.

p.s soz… to remove the rs logo you will need to delete it from the cache… its how i did it.[/quote]

Actually that usually causes a glitch i nthe two top corners of the login screen, just search for and remove this:

method58(25106); method58(25106);

Read full topic

item.title: Background
item.dc:creator: @jr0464 jr0464
item.description:
@jr0464 wrote:

Help me out with the flames as i dont understand how he said it put it in dumbass terms :S to remove the logo go into client.java search logo and change the 0 beside it to a 1

Read full topic

item.title: Background
item.dc:creator: @gooberboy686 gooberboy686
item.description:
@gooberboy686 wrote:

I got the flames removed, so thank you very much for that.

I don’t know where the logo would be in the cache, so could you please be a little more specific? Again, sorry with my dumb questions, but you’re being a big help.

Read full topic

item.title: Background
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

lol this is pretty easy to do…

in client.java search for this:

anIntArray851 = new int[256];       starting at that line, comment that line through and including
for(int j4 = 0; j4 < 64; j4++)
            anIntArray853[j4 + 192] = 0xffffff;

I know this definately removes the flames as i have done it myself… only issue with doing this is that when you login to server and then back out… you get a little glitch with the background where the flames used to be.

100% credits to “TREY” from another place for giving this to me! and i’ll be happy with a thanks for posting it.

p.s soz… to remove the rs logo you will need to delete it from the cache… its how i did it.

Read full topic
